content.description: Climb the dihedral right of Goddess.
Climb the dihedral right of Sunday Stroll.
content.protection: 1 early bolt, gear in the crack, rap station Goddess.
content.location: Left of Sunday Stroll.  Downclimb to Goddess rap station.

content.description: This is the first rout you come to on the left side when hiking up the gully to Treasure cove.  Start the climb on delicate pincher's and slopers to gain the short lived crack.  Stick a cam in the crack (1.5 inches) as high in the crack as you can and crank up to the first bolt.  Continue on a little easier terrain to the second bolt.  Then pull yourself over the lip and onto less vertical rock (crux).  Then run it out to slanted crack and place your piece of pro (1.5 inch cam) and climb licheny rock to the tree.
content.protection: 2 cams 1 to 2 inches.  2 quick draws for the bolts.  Webbing to sling the tree for an anchor.
content.location: Start the rout just to the left of the crack, then gain the crack once off the ground.  To get down, either leave webbing on the tree (not recommended) or climb up and left and circle back down on treacherous 4th and easy 5th class down climbing.

content.description: Climb a crack up to a vee shaped dihedral. Traverse right and go straight up.
content.protection: 1 bolt in the dihedral, gear, rap anchors.

content.description: Short crack problem just above Cakewalk. Good jams the whole way with a nice second crack for the first half
content.location: Climb Cakewalk, or scramble across ledge to reach the base.  Rap off Pint Sized Goddess.

content.description: Follow the slab/corner up to the base of Nasty Habits
Start with overhanging hand jams. Use the prickly knob to work past the seam and gain the hand jams at the exit. Quality moves from start to finish.
content.protection: Cams up to 2", small wires for the seam section.
content.location: Next crack line left of Nasty Habits.

content.description: The pyromania are is the first wall on the left side that you come to hiking up the gully to Treasure Cove.  Their are four known routes ranging in difficultly from 5.6 to 5.10c.  Pyromania is the most noticeable of the routes(See Picture).  Pyromania faces south, but the other routes face east and get shade after noon.  There is an abundance of poison ivy in the area, so be ware if you are allergic.
